solution.text:
by using Snell's law, \(n_1\times sin(30)=n_2\times sin(r)\)
\(_{{j*2}}_\times sin(30)=_{j}_\times sin(r)\)
we know sin(30)=\(1\over 2\)
sin(r)=\(_{{j*2}}_\over 2\times _{j}_\)
sin(r)=1
r=90

content.text:
When a ray of light passes from 1 medium to other the angle formed at the boundary of the two mediums with the normal is related by Snell's law
Given \(n_1\times sin(i)=n_2\times sin(r)\)(Snell's law), where \(n_1\)and \(n_2\) are the refractive index of medium1 and medium2.
If angle of incidence(i) is equal to 30 and \(n_1\) and \(n_2\) are _{{j*2}}_ and _{j}_ respectively.
Find the angle of refraction(r).
